p: The computational approach is proposed for drug and vaccine design [ 120]. To explore suitable natural inhibitors for the N-terminal receptor-binding domain of spike protein, the spike protein sequences were collected from a protein database. And also they were analyzed with various bioinformatics tools, attempting to identify suitable vaccine candidates by identifying B-Cell and T-cell epitopes [ 137]. In the drug design, the tanshinone Iia and methyl Tanshinonate were identified as natural inhibitors based on the docking score [ 138]. In the vaccine design, B-cell epitope VLLPLVSSQCVNLTTRTQLPPAYTN was found to have the highest antigenicity. FVFLVLLPL of MHC class-I allele and FVFLVLLPL of MHC class-II allele were identified as best peptides based on several alleles and antigenicity scores [ 139]. Therefore, identifies natural inhibitors and putative antigenic epitopes might be useful as effective drug and vaccine candidates for the eradication of novel coronavirus.
